seller.name: ITC Systems
seller.valueProposition: Unified credential management platform consolidating identity, access, payments, and services into a single solution

members.name: Paula Renae Scott
members.title: Chief Information Officer
members.roleReasoning: CIO with 30+ years IT experience in higher education. Ultimate technology decision maker. Previously CIO at University of Montana.

painPoints.title: Legacy System Integration Challenges
painPoints.description: Managing multiple disconnected systems for student ID, access control, dining, and payments creates operational inefficiency and poor user experience.
painPoints.impact: Students and staff must carry multiple credentials; IT team spends excessive time maintaining integrations.

painPoints.title: Mobile Credential Adoption Pressure
painPoints.description: Students expect mobile-first experiences. Current physical card systems feel outdated compared to peer institutions.
painPoints.impact: Risk of appearing technologically behind, affecting student recruitment and satisfaction.

members.name: Lisa Lewis Mangum
members.title: Associate CIO of Strategic Technology
members.roleReasoning: Oversees enterprise applications, project management, and IT contract review. Key influencer who evaluates solutions and manages vendor relationships.

painPoints.title: Enterprise Application Complexity
painPoints.description: Managing integrations between student information systems, ERP, and campus services requires significant resources.
painPoints.impact: Technical debt accumulates; new projects are delayed by integration requirements.

painPoints.title: Contract and Vendor Management
painPoints.description: Multiple vendors for different campus services creates procurement complexity and reduces negotiating power.
painPoints.impact: Higher total cost of ownership; inconsistent service levels across systems.

members.name: Lowell Richards
members.title: Associate Vice President for Student Affairs
members.roleReasoning: Oversees auxiliary operations including dining, bookstore, and campus services. Has budget authority for auxiliary technology investments.

painPoints.title: Declining Dining Revenue Capture
painPoints.description: Without modern POS and mobile ordering, campus dining loses revenue to off-campus alternatives and delivery apps.
painPoints.impact: Reduced meal plan utilization; lower auxiliary revenue that supports campus operations.

painPoints.title: Cash Handling Costs and Security
painPoints.description: Legacy cash-based systems in vending, laundry, and some dining locations create security risks and operational overhead.
painPoints.impact: Labor costs for cash collection; theft and loss risks; poor user experience.

members.name: Jennifer Steele
members.title: Vice President for Finance and University Planning
members.roleReasoning: CFO-equivalent role with budget authority for major university investments. Final approval required for significant technology purchases.

painPoints.title: Lack of Unified Financial Reporting
painPoints.description: Disparate transaction systems make it difficult to get comprehensive view of campus commerce and auxiliary revenues.
painPoints.impact: Delayed financial reporting; difficulty in budget planning and forecasting.

painPoints.title: Total Cost of Ownership Concerns
painPoints.description: Multiple point solutions from different vendors create hidden costs in maintenance, training, and integration.
painPoints.impact: Budget overruns; difficulty justifying technology investments.

members.name: Nicholas Shiosaki
members.title: Interim Chief Information Security Officer
members.roleReasoning: Security gatekeeper who must approve any system handling student data and campus access. Could block or delay if security concerns not addressed.

painPoints.title: Access Control Security Gaps
painPoints.description: Legacy access control systems may not meet modern security standards or provide adequate audit trails.
painPoints.impact: Campus safety concerns; compliance risks with student privacy regulations.

painPoints.title: Credential Management Vulnerabilities
painPoints.description: Physical cards can be lost, stolen, or duplicated. Need for more secure, revocable credentials.

members.name: Nyk Vail
members.title: Director of Technology Support
members.roleReasoning: Manages IT support services and will be responsible for supporting any new campus card system. Key technical evaluator. Started Aug 2024, 17 years higher ed experience from BYU-Idaho.

painPoints.title: Support Ticket Volume from Legacy Systems
painPoints.description: Outdated systems generate more support requests from students and staff struggling with usability issues.
painPoints.impact: IT support team overwhelmed; slower response times; frustrated users.

painPoints.title: Training and Documentation Gaps
painPoints.description: Multiple systems require separate training; institutional knowledge loss when staff turn over.

members.name: Russell Mayer
members.title: Budget Director
members.roleReasoning: Involved in budget allocation and financial planning. Will need to approve budget line items for major technology investments.

painPoints.title: Budget Cycle Timing Constraints
painPoints.description: Major technology purchases must align with university budget cycles and approval processes.
painPoints.impact: Projects can be delayed by missing budget windows.

members.name: Kathy Hoffman
members.title: Interim Director for Infrastructure Services
members.roleReasoning: Responsible for IT infrastructure that will support campus card system. Technical stakeholder for implementation planning.

painPoints.title: Infrastructure Capacity Planning
painPoints.description: Need to ensure network and server infrastructure can support new campus-wide systems.
